intro: Gomphandra cambodiana, commonly known as the Cambodian gomphandra, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
